channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Stocks shaking off early declines as investors parse retail sales — live updates
Tariffs won’t make America great again: Export-Import Bank former chairman and president
item.description: The American economy runs on trade. With his tariffs and trade wars, Trump risks stopping the engine of U.S. prosperity.

item.title: Board burnout is a major risk to all companies—Here’s how they can protect their top directors
item.description: There are three critical steps boards can take to protect their top people, according to experts.

item.title: Intel’s stock hasn’t gone on a run like this in decades — follow live
Pepsi paying $1.7 billion for beverage brand that got its start on ‘Shark Tank’
Tesla sales have ‘significantly underperformed’ in all key regions, analyst says
Why cruise stocks are a buy now, according to this analyst
TON surges 24% as Telegram founder Pavel Durov returns home to Dubai amid ongoing investigation
item.description: “The process is ongoing, it feels great to be home,” Durov wrote on Telegram Monday.

item.title: Foreign tourism into the U.S. is suddenly reversing and is now expected to drop, due in part to ‘polarizing Trump administration policies and rhetoric’
item.description: Tourism Economics President Adam Sacks said in the two weeks since the report came out, the situation has deteriorated further.

item.title: Bill Gates says Satya Nadella was ‘almost’ passed over for Microsoft CEO role
item.description: Bill Gates said he always backed Satya Nadella to lead Microsoft, but the current CEO was "almost" passed over in the succession process.
